page.title: 15A Day at the Printers
page.content: David Stirling, Laura Harbinson, Claire Setz and Susan Miskimming, first year pupils at Castle-Douglas High School, visited McElroy the Printers. McElroy employs 5 people; two women and three men. All the men and women use the computers, the machines and do the actual printing on paper. There are numerous modern machines. Photographs are developed in the Dark Room. Mr Hair likes to use the older printing machine but the other two men prefer the modern machines. There is a disc driven computer which collects and stores information. They have 2 floppy discs which contain very valuable information. They are the only 2 of their kind in the world. McElroy hope nothing ever happens to them.
